newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire rebel leader urges young men to join fight.
newsitem.headline: Zaire rebel leader urges young men to join fight.

text.p: Zairean rebel leader Laurent Kabila on Saturday urged thousands of young men in the country's second city -- which his army seized about a week ago -- to join his forces in its advance on the capital Kinshasa.

"We've not yet finished the job. The war is not finished. Kinshasa is not yet taken. We have to push this war and go on with our struggle against Mobutu to the end," Kabila told the crowd of 10,000 at a rally in Lubumbashi.
He appealed to the young men among the crowd to help him drive ailing President Mobutu Sese Seko, who has ruled the country for 32 years, from power.

Kabila flew back to Lubumbashi on Thursday from an overnight trip to South Africa, where he had held a new round of peace talks with President Nelson Mandela in an attempt to reach a peaceful solution to the six-month-old war against Mobutu.
